universum.studios.android.ui.graphics.drawable

Class LinearProgressDrawable

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.graphics.drawable.Drawable
      • universum.studios.android.ui.graphics.drawable.ProgressDrawable
        • universum.studios.android.ui.graphics.drawable.LinearProgressDrawable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animatable

    public class LinearProgressDrawable
extends ProgressDrawable
    A ProgressDrawable implementation which draws a progress or an indeterminate graphics as linear (rectangle) shape. Thickness (height) can be specified by ProgressDrawable.setThickness(float). Note, that as any drawable implementation also this drawable will draw its graphics into bounds set by Drawable.setBounds(int, int, int, int), the thickness set to this drawable is for informational purpose for a View which hosts this drawable to determine how much space (height) is needed to draw graphics of this drawable. The required height can be obtained by getIntrinsicHeight() and in case of width this drawable has no restrictions and will draw its graphics into width of the specified bounds, so it is up to the hosting View to determine its width.

    A color of the progress can be specified by setColor(int) or ProgressDrawable.setColors(int[]) where the specified set of colors will be used only in case of indeterminate mode. See description for MODE_INDETERMINATE below for more info. This progress drawable can also draw its background of which color can be specified by ProgressDrawable.setBackgroundColor(int). The background is drawn as a full progress rectangle with the specified thickness. By default is the background color set whenever setColor(int) is called. See this method description for more info.

    Note, that this progress drawable handles also different layout directions that can be specified by Drawable.setLayoutDirection(int).

    Whether to draw the progress or indeterminate graphics can be specified by setting a mode by setMode(int). The supported modes for this progress drawable class are described below.

    Modes

    • MODE_DETERMINATE

      A determinate mode should be used when an instance of LinearProgressDrawable should draw value of progress specified by ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int). The specified progress will be transformed into rectangle with width relative (getProgress() / getMax()) to the current bounds width.

      Note, that calls like ProgressDrawable.start(), ProgressDrawable.stop() are for this mode ignored.

    • MODE_INDETERMINATE

      An indeterminate mode should be used when an instance of LinearProgressDrawable should draw the indeterminate graphics. The indeterminate graphics drawing is implemented as infinite amount of consecutive loops, where each of these loops is consisted of progressive translation (along x axis) of two "indeterminate blocks" (rectangles). The first one is called "leading block" which is progressively expanding and the second one is called "following block" which is started to be drawn after the lading block is translated by a specific distance. The following block is drawn in width of the lading block and it is progressively collapsing and "tries" to catch up with the leading block. This is, for purpose of the LinearProgressDrawable, called described in class overview of ProgressDrawable indeterminate animation session.

      The animation session can be started by ProgressDrawable.start() and stopped by ProgressDrawable.stop() or ProgressDrawable.stopImmediate(). The difference between those two stop methods is that if requested to not stop immediately via stop(), the drawing of the indeterminate graphics will be stopped after the block that is following the heading block is fully translated out from the available drawing area otherwise it will look like the indeterminate blocks just "vanished".

      This mode supports multi-coloring feature which can be enabled by ProgressDrawable.setMultiColored(boolean). If this feature is enabled, the set of colors specified by ProgressDrawable.setColors(int[]) will be used to change color of the indeterminate blocks and background whenever the following block is fully translated out from the available drawing area. If the end of the colors array is reached, the next color will be picked again from the beginning of the array and so on.

      Note, that calls like ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int) or setSecondaryProgress(int) are for this mode ignored.

    • MODE_BUFFER

      A buffer mode should be used when an instance of LinearProgressDrawable should draw value of progress specified by ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int) with also value of secondary (buffer) progress specified by setSecondaryProgress(int). A color of the buffer progress can be specified by setSecondaryColor(int), but by default this color is automatically set whenever setColor(int) is called with the same logic as background color.

      This mode also supports one indeterminate animation which can be started by ProgressDrawable.start() and stopped by ProgressDrawable.stop() or ProgressDrawable.stopImmediate() as described for MODE_INDETERMINATE above. This will draw a set of circles (buffer marks) aligned along x axis in the drawing area not yet used by secondary progress graphics. The animation is indeterminate because, the circles are progressively translated against the rectangle drawn as the secondary progress and also scaled down and up in the predefined interval. For this animation purpose can be specified two parameters, duration by setBufferIndeterminateMarksScaleDuration(long) and interval, which determines how often should be the scale up/down animation of the buffer marks run by setBufferIndeterminateMarksScaleInterval(long).

      Note, that this progress drawable does not handle any unnecessary logic for this mode purpose, like stopping of the indeterminate animation session after the secondary progress is at its maximum value specified by ProgressDrawable.setMax(int) when the indeterminate buffer marks do not need to be drawn, so this is upon the progress view which uses this drawable to draw its progress.

    • MODE_QUERY_INDETERMINATE_DETERMINATE

      A query-indeterminate and determinate mode should be used when an instance of LinearProgressDrawable should draw a reversed (in direction) indeterminate graphics like in MODE_INDETERMINATE, to indicate at the start that a progress view which hosts this progress drawable is preparing for progress updates, and than allow to draw the progress value specified by ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int) like in MODE_DETERMINATE.

      Note, that this progress drawable does not handle any unnecessary logic for this mode purpose, like stopping of the indeterminate animation session after first progress has been, so this is upon to the progress view which uses this drawable to draw its progress.

    Tinting

    This progress drawable implementation extends base tinting API extended from its parent via following setters:
    • setSecondaryProgressTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)
    • setSecondaryProgressTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode)
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MODE_BUFFER
      Flag to request BUFFER mode for LinearProgressDrawable which allows to set a progress value by ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int) and a buffered value by setSecondaryProgress(int).
      static int MODE_DETERMINATE
      Flag to request DETERMINATE mode for LinearProgressDrawable which allows to set a progress value by ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int).

      Flag to request INDETERMINATE mode for LinearProgressDrawable which enables indeterminate animation.
      static int MODE_QUERY_INDETERMINATE_DETERMINATE
      Flag to request QUERY INDETERMINATE and DETERMINATE mode for LinearProgressDrawable which enables reversed indeterminate animation and allows to set a progress value by ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int).

      • setSecondaryProgress

        public void setSecondaryProgress(int secondaryProgress)
        Sets the current progress value of this progress drawable which determines size of secondary progress drawn by this drawable.

        Does nothing if the current mode is not BUFFER.

        Parameters:
        secondaryProgress - The desired secondary progress. Should be from the range [0, getMax()].
        See Also:
        getSecondaryProgress()

      • getSecondaryProgress

        public int getSecondaryProgress()
        Returns the secondary progress value set to this progress drawable by setSecondaryProgress(int).
        Returns:
        Current secondary progress or 0 if the current mode is not BUFFER.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int color)
        Sets the color used to draw graphics of this progress drawable.

        For all modes supported by this progress drawable, excepts MODE_BUFFER, this call will use the specified color to automatically set also background color using ProgressDrawable.setBackgroundColor(int) with modified alpha value for proper contrast between progress and background graphics.

        Note, that this color is used only if the multicolored mode is disabled. See ProgressDrawable.setMultiColored(boolean) for more info.

        Overrides:
        setColor in class ProgressDrawable
        Parameters:
        color - The desired color.
        See Also:
        ProgressDrawable.getColor()

      • setSecondaryColor

        public void setSecondaryColor(int secondaryColor)
        Sets the color used to draw secondary graphics (secondary progress) of this progress drawable.
        Parameters:
        secondaryColor - The desired color.
        See Also:
        getSecondaryColor()

        Returns:
        The current secondary color. This color can be modified whenever setAlpha(int) is called.

      • setSecondaryProgressTintList

        public void setSecondaryProgressTintList(@Nullable
                                         ColorStateList tint)
        Sets a tint for the secondary progress graphics of this drawable.

        Setting a color filter via ProgressDrawable.setColorFilter(android.graphics.ColorFilter) will override the tint.

        Parameters:
        tint - Color state list to use for tinting of the secondary progress graphics. Can be null to clear the current secondary progress tint.

      • setSecondaryProgressTintMode

                                         PorterDuff.Mode tintMode)

        Setting a color filter via ProgressDrawable.setColorFilter(android.graphics.ColorFilter) will override the tint.

        Parameters:
        tintMode - The desired Porter-Duff blending mode.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)
        Description copied from class: ProgressDrawable
        Changes mode of this progress drawable. The progress mode specifies behaviour and drawing of this drawable and its progress.

        Note, that changing the current mode will not affect in any way currently running animation session, just drawing behaviour of the progress/indeterminate graphics. This means, that changing mode to for example INDETERMINATE will not start indeterminate animation session by ProgressDrawable.start(), this is responsibility of the user (view) of this drawable to start or stop animations properly. This is due to performance, so changing mode will not start animations at time when the view which hosts this drawable is not attached to window yet.

        Overrides:
        setMode in class ProgressDrawable
        Parameters:
        mode - A flag of the desired mode.
        See Also:
        ProgressDrawable.getMode()

      • setBufferIndeterminateMarksScaleInterval

        public void setBufferIndeterminateMarksScaleInterval(long interval)
        Sets the interval for the indeterminate buffer marks scale animation. This interval determines how often should be the scale animation run, more closely, how often should be the buffer marks scaled up/down.

        Default value: 5000 ms

        Parameters:
        interval - The desired interval in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        getBufferIndeterminateMarksScaleInterval()

        Returns:

      • onDrawBackground

        protected void onDrawBackground(@NonNull
                                Canvas canvas,
                                @NonNull
                                Paint paint,
                                @Nullable
                                ColorFilter colorFilter)
        Description copied from class: ProgressDrawable
        Invoked whenever ProgressDrawable.draw(android.graphics.Canvas) is called for this progress drawable and there is background color set and its alpha value is not 0.

        Note, that any color filter set to the given paint will be clear after this call.

        Overrides:
        onDrawBackground in class ProgressDrawable
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas on which to draw background graphics.
        paint - A paint that can be used for drawing operations. This paint has already tint filter specified, based on ProgressDrawable.setBackgroundTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) and ProgressDrawable.setBackgroundTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode) parameters.
        colorFilter - Color filter obtained from the specified paint.
